channel.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
channel.description:
[quote="xx qwertyuiop xx, post:7, topic:184231"][quote author=Taharok link=topic=245905.msg2073544#msg2073544 date=1203844342] I thought that tutorials had to follow the Java conventions.. [/quote] Yes, but the rules here aren't enforced. So anything works.[/quote]
I have to half agree with him. This is quoted from the tutorial section and proves a great point. There are only two moparscape mods that have any posts in the tutorials section, and not many even between them. Evil_ and Tico135 are the only ones with recorded statistics of posting inside of the tutorial section at all. This means Click Here has less than 2 posts in the tutorial section (assumed 0) and Ikiliki has less than 36 (assumed less than 10). Even Evil_ only has 29 total posts in the tutorial section. It looks to me as though Tico is the only moparscape mod doing anything inside the tutorial section. And, the moparscape boards are impossible to manage with a single moderator. I think that the other moderators need to start expanding on which boards they moderate to greatly reduce the quantity of moderating needed to manage this site.
Edit: And one other thing, one of you need to get out the noob stick and start hitting people in the balls. MoparScapers are thinking they can bend the rules again...

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @fedexer -fedexer-
item.description:
@fedexer wrote:

Well i don’t actually have much say here anymore as i got severely inactive, but it would definetly seem that trusted members need to be found, and some action taken to make sure the sections are kept in order.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Yes. You say we need positive-attitude members and I am being negative to finding any. =P

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Anyone feeling the irony here?

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Aftermath:

Here, I have a suggestion: Get some staff members who actually have a positive attitude.

This could be very difficult in this type of community.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

WE have positive attitudes, it’s just we have different opinions about things.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Here, I have a suggestion: Get some staff members who actually have a positive attitude.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

ThugLife:

A mute for all those who break the rule, simple as.

Then the gmods would be working all day to fulfill that.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Believe it or not, there are people older than five on this website.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

A mute for all those who break the rule, simple as.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=Taharok link=topic=249514.msg2105526#msg2105526 date=1205375492]these are teenagers

No, they are pre-teenagers, they are kids. We should start acting like them, throw a tantrum when we don’t get what we want. The forum doesn’t need less “strict” rules, it needs plain, simple, easy to understand rules that 5 year olds can understand, since we’re dealing with 5 year olds.[/quote]

True, but honestly, how much clearer can you make “No copy and paste tutorials allowed?” shall we indent it on their brains or something? Because they still aren’t getting it.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Taharok:

these are teenagers

No, they are pre-teenagers, they are kids. We should start acting like them, throw a tantrum when we don’t get what we want. The forum doesn’t need less “strict” rules, it needs plain, simple, easy to understand rules that 5 year olds can understand, since we’re dealing with 5 year olds.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Rules can be enforced all you want, but you will realize that the reality of enforcing rules on a community completely made up of immature teenagers, the end result would be the destruction of the forum.

Why make rules so strict? Strict rules are unneeded. All you need is constantly active moderators (even for a few minutes a night, overall making more moderators necessary) who are willing to enforce those rules word-for-word. Their perception of the rules is also vital for punishments, otherwise a revolt of members could brew up.

And about the life lesson, these are teenagers. Unless they are not normal, they probably don’t dwell too much on life changing things.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Nothing wrong with doing it while they’re here. Rules are a life lesson, and so are punishments. They are everywhere you go.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Yes, except this forum is not designed to teach you life lessons. If you want to learn life lessons, go live life. If you want to play MoparScape, come here. And all of these rules just for the sake of having rules are hindering the forum.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

If they choose not to follow the rules, they choose to be punished. In the end they will lose, if they want to act like idiots and not read the guidelines/rules stated, then let them be idiots. Only in the end they will lose, and hopefully learn that they should have more respect for things like this.

People don’t realize how much of a life lesson forums like this can be. In any simple job, if you choose not to follow the rules, you choose to receive a punishment. Usually you’ll get a pay cut, or be fired, as you had no respect for the rules, and therefore your boss should have no respect for you. It should be the same way here. Nothing should change that.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Of course you should not have to tell them. Who cares. They are going to not follow the rules anyway. They are people, they believe rules are meant to be broken (directly or indirectly).

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:62, topic:186975”]Moparisthebest, you know as well as everyone else that Click Here doesnt moderate moparisthebest.com anymore. So, just putting it out there, why is he still part of the staff?

Taharok, ‘cheat clients’ do help the RS2 private server field. The client does things it is not supposed to - and its up to the server owner to fix that. Getting rid of the security holes and vulnerabilities is learning, I assume? Well, its definitely a step up from the present. I thought we wanted the people here to learn things and be more creative. It’s NOT going to happen IF WE DONT push them into doing it.

I also agree with the reset on the Dev/Help and MS Question boards. And if possible, the whole forum. I understand and I see where you’re coming from when you regarded this suggestion earlier, but think about it. Before our newly appointed staff for these boards, Ikiliki and occasionally Silab were the only ones who really moderated the forum. It was hard to keep up with the constant rule-breaking. So many posts were made that did not follow the guidelines, and they are still constantly being brought back up from the grave by users. They’re not needed topics anymore - there’s no point. In addition, the users registered here continue to break the rules, thinking that some are not enforced as well as they should be and ignoring the punishments that can be given. If we had an entire forum reset, then we could start clean. Enforce the rules as best as possible - not letting any of the rule-breaking occur, and letting the community know how it’s done from here on out. I dunno, I just felt like commenting on that.

Also, why do the forums crash after a ban is made? And why would it be so hard to fix?[/quote]

It’s completely an admin decision to demod Click Here. I do not see anything wrong with him as a person, but he just really doesn’t do anything for MoparScape. If it were me I would ask him if he had anything wrong with being demodded for the good of the site. If he said he was going to start being more active that would be fully ok, but if he realizes that he’s not going to be more active, I think he is a good enough of a person to say yes. However I would leave his vet position, it’s doing no wrong. That’s just my opinion, but I have no control over it.

As Moparisthebest has said cheat clients are not against the rules as this a cheating community, but I don’t like the factor when someone impersonates azn and posts the client. That’s when we have to draw the line. We can’t overally push them, and I don’t see an overall superb way of doing it, but if you have an idea, I’d post it so we can discuss it.

I don’t really know about a reset of the MoparScape Client Questions Section and Development/Help, but again, as Moparisthebest has stated a reset will not happen again. The only thing that we can do against the factor of people pulling up dead topics is warning/muting them when they do something like that. They should already know that is not allowed, we should not have to tell them.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:63, topic:186975”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=249514.msg2101875#msg2101875 date=1205208402]
Taharok, ‘cheat clients’ do help the RS2 private server field. The client does things it is not supposed to - and its up to the server owner to fix that. Getting rid of the security holes and vulnerabilities is learning, I assume? Well, its definitely a step up from the present. I thought we wanted the people here to learn things and be more creative. It’s NOT going to happen IF WE DONT push them into doing it.
[/quote]

You really don’t read, do you?[/quote]Not at all, Taharok.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Moparisthebest, you know as well as everyone else that Click Here doesnt moderate moparisthebest.com anymore. So, just putting it out there, why is he still part of the staff?

Taharok, ‘cheat clients’ do help the RS2 private server field. The client does things it is not supposed to - and its up to the server owner to fix that. Getting rid of the security holes and vulnerabilities is learning, I assume? Well, its definitely a step up from the present. I thought we wanted the people here to learn things and be more creative. It’s NOT going to happen IF WE DONT push them into doing it.

I also agree with the reset on the Dev/Help and MS Question boards. And if possible, the whole forum. I understand and I see where you’re coming from when you regarded this suggestion earlier, but think about it. Before our newly appointed staff for these boards, Ikiliki and occasionally Silab were the only ones who really moderated the forum. It was hard to keep up with the constant rule-breaking. So many posts were made that did not follow the guidelines, and they are still constantly being brought back up from the grave by users. They’re not needed topics anymore - there’s no point. In addition, the users registered here continue to break the rules, thinking that some are not enforced as well as they should be and ignoring the punishments that can be given. If we had an entire forum reset, then we could start clean. Enforce the rules as best as possible - not letting any of the rule-breaking occur, and letting the community know how it’s done from here on out. I dunno, I just felt like commenting on that.

Also, why do the forums crash after a ban is made? And why would it be so hard to fix?

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Warnings auto-expire now, and I still need to do something about the banning system, but we still can’t just ban people because they are stupid or without sufficient reason.

I fail to agree, but I suppose you the boss.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @god_of_ikiliki god of ikiliki
item.description:
@god_of_ikiliki wrote:

Basically I have to agree with ThugLife a little bit about a reset on Development/Help and Moparscape Questions.
The old posts are being bumped too much, if you want people to read other posts through searching, then at least lock the older posts, because the bumps are quiet annoying, they’re a good way to receive post count these days.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yes but mopar, you can’t say that if new moderators were put into place (as in a good few) that a reset of the dev/help & Moparscape questions section would help the new moderators keep on top of all the shit.

Tico135 click here just does not care for these forums anymore, even when he does log on he does not even look over these side of the boards

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I agree that we need more moderators for moparscape, but as Lothy mentioned earlier, finding trustworthy members that are from moparisthebest.com is fairly hard to do, there are certainly trustworthy members on the forums, but most aren’t active at all at moparisthebest.com and therefore would not make good moderators for it.

Ikiliki and I are as active as we can, Evil_ has school and being a fireman, Silab is to busy making money :P, and Click Here is just going through college so we do what we can.

Currently I really don’t see anyone who would do a good job moderating the forum, and who is as active.

Read full topic

item.title: Attention: MoparScape moderators
item.dc:creator: @god_of_ikiliki god of ikiliki
item.description:
@god_of_ikiliki wrote:

Okay thanks for that information.

Moparisthebest:

Warnings auto-expire now, and I still need to do something about the banning system, but we still can’t just ban people because they are stupid or without sufficient reason.

How long do the warnings, moderations and mutes last on default now?

Read full topic
